Tuesday, June 19, 2007























Disbarred Duke lacrosse D.A. faces ruin
His law license lost and reputation in tatters, Mike Nifong seemingly can fall no further. But the disgraced prosecutor faces an uncertain -- and likely troubled -- future. 
FULL STORY

•  Cleared players settle score with Duke
•  Duke prosecutor disbarred
•  Cop: D.A. pushed case despite doubts


























NANCY GRACE Airs on Headline PRIME, 8 p.m. ET
"Nancy Grace" is television's only justice-themed interview and debate show. Nancy Grace challenges guests
on the most controversial and high-profile legal issues of the day by drawing on her unique perspective
as a former violent crimes prosecutor and as a crime victim herself.  Send your questions and comments.





















Hilton prosecutor hushed up crash 
He got Paris Hilton locked up. On Monday, L.A. City Attorney Rocky Delgadillo apologized for keeping quiet a crash involving his wife, a suspended license and his city-owned car.
FULL STORY






Mob trial promises to be a hit
It seemed like a good idea at the time. A gang of burglars decided to break into the home of Tony Accardo, one of the most powerful men in organized crime history.
FULL STORY






$54M lost pants case on last leg
A lawsuit against a dry cleaners has focused on the term "satisfaction guaranteed" and where to draw the line when a customer demands satisfaction.
FULL STORY






'Junior' Gotti's going south
John "Junior" Gotti is selling his estate and preparing for an eventual move to the South, far from the region where his father was a notorious mob boss.
FULL STORY
